item.description: Initial state The initial state of the simulation is the Token Generation Event. From this point forwards: The first tokens have been minted and distributed or sold to investors The token economy is live, with a market facilitating the exchange of tokens for USD The token utility is available, with app developers being able to exchange tokens for network credits Vesting schedules for investors and the treasury begin to vest The minting events beggin to occur periodically Most simulation variables are initialized at this point.
Sells or buys the input tokens
DAUs -> $D(t)$ Staking period length -> $\Delta t_s$ Max DAUs in staking period -> $$ D_s = \max_{T > t - \Delta t_s ; T < t} D(T) $$

Updates [[../../Agents/App developers]] staked tokens taking the discount into account (amount from [[../App developers/Staked tokens]]) Calculates the USD value that the developers should burn to service the users from the DAUs, credit price and fraction of a day passed in the time step
Daily Active Users The simulation adops an hypotheses on the evolution of Daily Active Users through time. This evolution is determined by a set of parameters that define the shape of the curve.
Liquidity Provision Both investors and the treasury are liquidity providers to the AUKI/USD [[../../Agents/AMM]] that acts as the market for the token.

The metrics have the following fields: time Time elapsed since the start of the simulation years Years passed since the start of the simulation day Current day since the start of the simulation (simulation starts at day 1) price Current marginal price in the [[.
Get the tokens to mint from the [[Minting calculator]] Set the burnt tokens since the last minting to 0 Update the total minted tokens
Constant deflation rate Burnt tokens since last minting -> $B$ Deflation rate -> $r$ Minting $$ M(B) = r B $$
From the minted tokens since last minting and the rewards ratio, get the base number of tokens that should go to the [[.
The [[../../Agents/Operators]] immediately sell the [[../../Agents/Operators]] rewards from to the [[../../Agents/AMM]] Only decentralized operators get the rewards, so only they have earnings
Sessions per worker -> $s$ Sessions per worker minimum incentivized -> $s_0$ Sessions per worker maximum incentivized -> $s_f$ Max incentives ratio -> $r_f$
The [[../../Agents/Operators]] leaving sell all their tokens The overstaked [[../../Agents/Operators]] sell their surplus of tokens If there are enough tokens in the [[.
Simulation step Each step advances the simulation by a time step, which is 6 hours by default. time += time_step -> $t_s = t_{s-1} + \Delta t$
The [[../../Agents/Treasury]] makes sales to the [[../../Agents/AMM]] according to the [[Treasury sales schedule]] capped by the number of tokens the [[.

Vesting schedule The simulation considers vesting schedules for some investors and for the treasury. Each simulation step, the amount vested since the last step is calculated and added to the corresponding balance.
